definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

sentences.english: European influence gradually brought an end to this regional power.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲勢力的逐漸地入侵，結束了這種地域性的霸權。

sentences.english: A hegemonic country obtains privileged interests from currency hegemony, but pays costs too.
sentences.chinese: 霸權國不僅獲取特權利益，也付出成本。

sentences.english: The final key to Europe's world hegemony was her military superiority.
sentences.chinese: 世界霸權的地位的最終關鍵是其軍事優勢。

sentences.english: " At least, "Monroe Doctrine" is the United States, the important principle of regional hegemony.
sentences.chinese: 至少“門羅主義”是美國的地區霸權主義的重要原則。

sentences.english: Only in the dominated structure and purpose do the different forms of power turn into various hegemonies and violence.
sentences.chinese: 教育權力在支配性結構中轉變成消極的霸權或暴力。

sentences.english: For unlike the great powers of old, we have not sought world domination.
sentences.chinese: 與歷代強國不同，我們沒有追求世界霸權。

sentences.english: Hegemonism and power politics have new manifestations.
sentences.chinese: 霸權主義和強權政治有新的表現。

sentences.english: For half a century the dollar has been the hegemonic currency.
sentences.chinese: 美元處於霸權地位的情況已持續了半個世紀。

sentences.english: Unipolar hegemony of the United States can not be successful.
sentences.chinese: 單極化的美國霸權是不能成功的。

sentences.english: The terrorism and hegemonism are the two big historical persistent ailments that the human society faces.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主義和霸權主義是人類社會面臨的兩大歷史頑症。

sentences.english: Hegemonism has been embedded in the mind of some American politicians.
sentences.chinese: 霸權主義思想已深深印入某些美國政客的腦海。

sentences.english: Having 11 aircraft carriers makes the United States "a real world power", he said.
sentences.chinese: 正是11艘航空母艦讓美國成爲世界霸權。

sentences.english: First of all, this thesis begins with the study on post-colonial theory and cultural hegemony.
sentences.chinese: 本論文首先探討了後殖民理論和文化霸權。

sentences.english: All the historical pretenders to global power originated in Eurasia.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上所有力圖奪取全球霸權的勢力發源於歐亞大陸。

sentences.english: Second, China opposes hegemonism and upholds world peace.
sentences.chinese: 第二，中國反對霸權主義，維護世界和平。

sentences.english: He was determined to challenge Swedish supremacy.
sentences.chinese: 他堅定地要挑戰瑞典的霸權。

definition: peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
